snippet: Forty people from the Gaza Strip were allowed to visit their husbands and sons inside the Ramon Prison in southern Israel on Monday for the first time in more than five years.
abstract: Forty people from the Gaza Strip are allowed to visit their husbands and sons inside the Ramon Prison in southern Israel for the first time in more than five years, as part of deal Israel made with the prisoners to end a mass hunger strike.
lead_paragraph: Forty people from the Gaza Strip were allowed to visit their husbands and sons inside the Ramon Prison in southern Israel on Monday for the first time in more than five years.
